Multiple Orders

A goal I had in mind when designing this platform was to allow strategies to hold multiple orders across any market - if the strategy calls for holding 10 sell limit orders at different prices, the platform should allow for this and keep track of the status of each of those orders.

I’d not seen any other open source project that allowed for this approach and wanted to try strategies that were passive in nature rather than trying to compete with the high speed trading approach.

Data Sets

I created a script to scrape historic data from CoinGecko for use in the back-tester, allowing users a wide selection of price histories to back-test their strategies against.

I also built a generator to get random new chart shapes to try out (though it’s not very sophisticated).

[IMAGE: chart generator]

Tick Cycle

To

One of the key goals I had in mind while designing the runner was to allow the user to write a minimum amount of code in their strategies. Here’s what I did to achieve this:

  • Created a cycle of: processLastTick > calculateCurrentTick > processCurrentTick to handle any common work
  • Created a dynamic form, built from the form field schema and default values given by the strategy
